description: Borrowed from Spanish quinua, from Quechua kinwa.

entries.meaning: A goosefoot (Chenopodium quinoa) native to the Andes and cultivated for its edible seeds.
examples: Chenopodium quinoa Will, (quinoa) is native to the Andes, and the seeds are a staple grain in parts of South America. The newly formed Canadian Quinoa Association anticipated growing about 400 ha of quinoa annually (Anonymous 1992e).

entries.meaning: The high-protein dried fruits and seeds of this plant, used as a food staple and ground into flour.
examples: Turn the heat up to medium-high, add the quinoa, and sprinkle with salt and pepper.
